title: K-12 Complex Problem-Solving Strategies Through Case-Based Reasoning

context.prior_knowledge: Core problem-solving methodologies and language domain expertise
context.additional_context: Case-based learning utilizing success/failure scenarios in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze success and failure cases to solve complex language-related problems and apply solutions to similar issues

Learners can construct three arguments (initial claim, counterargument, rebuttal) within three sentences each for a given business/HR problem (e.g., employee motivation strategies) and write an argumentative report that meets four or more of five logical connectivity checklist items.
Learners can creatively propose new problem-solving strategies based on lessons derived from failure cases

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
